captures.author: @garrytan
captures.text: I think people are sleeping a bit on how much Ruby on Rails + Claude Code is a *crazy unlock* - I mean Rails was designed for people who love syntactic sugar, and LLMs are sugar fiends.
captures.whyInteresting: YC president's insight on Rails+Claude Code synergy - actionable for dev workflow

captures.author: @AlexanderTw33ts
captures.text: I launched humans4agents.ai last night and already 130+ people have signed up including an OF model and the CEO of an AI startup. If your AI agent wants to rent a person to do an IRL task for them its as simple as one MCP call.
captures.whyInteresting: Novel agent infrastructure - humans as an MCP endpoint for agents to hire

captures.author: @cryptopunk7213
captures.text: man anthropic is about to drop the mother-of-all ai models tmrw: crushes opus 4.5 at coding WHILE BEING 50% CHEAPER, new Swarm feature lets you spin up *multiple teams* of agents that run in parallel...
captures.whyInteresting: Anthropic release rumors - take with salt but worth tracking

captures.author: @dishantwt_
captures.text: hear me out: an IDE that shows you ads while your agent is spinning and your ads pay for the tokens
captures.whyInteresting: Clever business model idea - ads subsidizing AI compute

captures.author: @AlexReibman
captures.text: Codex app has built-in cron jobs. Probably the first lab to launch a product like this. Copying a major reason why OpenClaw is so good
captures.whyInteresting: OpenAI Codex now has cron - competitive validation of our approach

captures.author: @sheeki03
captures.text: Be honest. When was the last time you actually read a command before pasting it into your terminal? Because these two lines look identical... One installs your tool. The other steals your SSH keys. That Ñ–? Cyrillic. So I built the fix: tirith
captures.whyInteresting: Security tool for vibe coding era - catches homograph attacks in terminal commands

captures.author: @mattshumer_
captures.text: Agents can now collaborate with each other on big projects in MoltSlack, just like humans do in Slack. Welcome to the Agent Workforce.
captures.whyInteresting: Matt Shumer's agent collaboration infrastructure - Slack for agents

captures.author: @mvanhorn
captures.text: I wanted a cheat sheet of real @openclaw workflows people are running today. Asked @slashlast30days and it crushed it. Here's a thread: VERY SPECIFIC OpenClaw Workflows (Proven & Running)
captures.whyInteresting: Curated real-world OpenClaw workflows - directly applicable

captures.author: @deepfates
captures.text: Crazy how Claude is a lazy frontend dev and Codex is a neurotic short-sighted backend guy. They managed to recreate all the programmer archetypes. Even Gemini, the junior engineer about to rope
captures.whyInteresting: Hilarious accurate take on model personalities

captures.author: @Ar_boian
captures.text: Brian Chesky's vision for an AI-first world is miles ahead of the Silicon Valley narrative. Haven't seen it this clearly since Steve Jobs.
captures.whyInteresting: Airbnb CEO's AI vision - worth watching the clip

captures.author: @damianplayer
captures.text: stop trying to innovate with AI. every business runs on the same 5-6 core processes. the people making real money with AI aren't reinventing the wheel. they mapped what already works and automated it.
captures.whyInteresting: Practical AI monetization insight - automate existing processes, don't innovate

captures.author: @Architect9000
captures.text: Don't worry about software engineers losing their jobs. Worry about what unemployed engineers will do to yours. Engineers are lifelong learners... Software skills going to be mandatory for any white-collar job by 2030.
captures.whyInteresting: Interesting thesis on displaced engineers automating other fields

captures.author: @jiratickets
captures.text: google trends data. I don't think most of you realize how insane this is.
captures.whyInteresting: Google Trends showing something significant - need to see the image

captures.author: @ramxcodes
captures.text: The best obsidian folder structure so far
captures.whyInteresting: Obsidian organization reference - productivity

captures.author: @leerob
captures.text: Cursor tip: before pushing a PR, ask the agent to break your changes into a series of commits for easier review. You can even stack skills like: /code-review, /simplify, /deslop, /commit-pr
captures.whyInteresting: Vercel's Lee Robinson with practical Cursor workflow tips

captures.author: @arscontexta
captures.text: if youre into agentic knowledge management, install this cli tool from @steipete - summarize any URL, PDF, or YouTube in one command and dump it straight into your vault
captures.whyInteresting: Steipete's CLI for agentic knowledge management - directly relevant

captures.author: @hasantoxr
captures.text: BREAKING: Microsoft just solved the Agent Loop problem. Agent Lightning is an open-source framework that lets agents learn from their own mistakes using Reinforcement Learning.
captures.whyInteresting: Microsoft's Agent Lightning - RL for self-improving agents, open source

captures.author: @zachkrall
captures.text: the terminal is quietly becoming one of the most interesting surfaces in interaction design. i've been experimenting with what a personal website feels like when it lives in the terminal instead of a browser
captures.whyInteresting: Terminal-first design exploration - aesthetic and practical

captures.author: @OpenRouterAI
captures.text: OpenClaw tip: ask it to use the Step 3.5 Flash model. Fast, powerful, and free
captures.whyInteresting: OpenRouter tip for free fast model - practical cost savings

captures.author: @kimmonismus
captures.text: Seriously, what is actually happening internally at OpenAI and Anthropic? 2026 is the year everything changes. 2024 and 2025 were just the prelude.
captures.whyInteresting: Observations on AI lab developments - images show hiring patterns
